text: Ellesmere (pronounced Ellz-meer) is a small market town in Shropshire, a county in England. The 2011 census recorded 3,835 people living there. It is close to the border with Wales. The town centre is north of Shrewsbury, the county town. It is north-east of Oswestry and south-east of the Welsh town of Wrexham. It is located right next to Ellesmere, one of the largest natural meres in England that is outside of the Lake District. Famous engineer Thomas Telford lived in Ellesmere in the 1790s. ==Twinning== Ellesmere is twinned with: * Diksmuide, Belgium ==Gallery== File:Ellesmere_Town_Centre_- _geograph.org.uk_-_6709.jpg|Ellesmere Town Centre File:Black_Lion_Hotel,_Ellesmere.jpg|Black Lion Hotel File:St_Mary's_Church,_Ellesmere,_October_2014.JPG|St Mary's Church Category:Market towns in Shropshire Category:Civil parishes in Shropshire
title: Ellesmere, Shropshire
